main event: Two round objects, size of half dollar, with color changing from intense white to dark red were observed near Mineral Wells, Texas on July 18, 1960.
interesting points: The objects faded, became bright, and moved in a zigzag pattern before being obscured by clouds.
The objects were described as having a 'ball-on-a-wire' type of motion, which was considered as a possible explanation for ball lightning.
Despite the conclusion that the objects were probably balloons, the report noted that the size, color, and motion of the objects were not typical of balloons.
The sighting was categorized as 'insufficient data for evaluation' due to there being only one witness.
The report includes a detailed analysis of the weather conditions, astronomical phenomena, and other potential explanations for the sighting.
location: 3 mi S of Mineral Wells, Texas
